com.konakart.db

Class KKDB2NetAdapter

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.torque.adapter.AbstractAdapter
      • com.konakart.db.KKDB2NetAdapter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, org.apache.torque.adapter.Adapter

    public class KKDB2NetAdapter
extends org.apache.torque.adapter.AbstractAdapter
    This is used to connect to a DB2 database.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

        Overrides:

        Returns:

        Parameters:
        con - The JDBC connection to use.
        table - The name of the table to lock.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - No Statement could be created or executed.

      • unlockTable

        public void unlockTable(java.sql.Connection con,
               java.lang.String table)
                 throws java.sql.SQLException
        Tries to unlock the specified table. This implementation does nothing as tables in MSSQL are unlocked when a commit or rollback is issued. This has unintended side effects, as well as we do not know whether to use commit or rollback. The lock will go away automatically when the transaction is ended.
        Specified by:
        unlockTable in interface org.apache.torque.adapter.Adapter
        Specified by:
        unlockTable in class org.apache.torque.adapter.AbstractAdapter
        Parameters:
        con - The JDBC connection to use.
        table - The name of the table to unlock.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - No Statement could be created or executed.

        Specified by:

        offset - the offset Value

        Throws:

      • escapeText

        public boolean escapeText()
        Determines whether backslashes (\) should be escaped in explicit SQL strings. If true is returned, a BACKSLASH will be changed to "\\". If false is returned, a BACKSLASH will be left as "\". DB2 doesn't define a default escape character, so false is returned.
        Specified by:
        escapeText in interface org.apache.torque.adapter.Adapter
        Overrides:
        escapeText in class org.apache.torque.adapter.AbstractAdapter
        Returns:
        false
        See Also:
        Adapter.escapeText()

      • useEscapeClauseForLike

        public boolean useEscapeClauseForLike()
        Whether an escape clause in like should be used. Example : select * from AUTHOR where AUTHOR.NAME like '\_%' ESCAPE '\'; DB2 needs this, so this implementation always returns true.
        Specified by:
        useEscapeClauseForLike in interface org.apache.torque.adapter.Adapter
        Overrides:
        useEscapeClauseForLike in class org.apache.torque.adapter.AbstractAdapter
        Returns:
        whether the escape clause should be appended or not.
